newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: RUGBY UNION-LIONS MAKE FOUR CHANGES FOR FINAL TEST.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-LIONS MAKE FOUR CHANGES FOR FINAL TEST.

text.p: The British Lions have made four changes in their side for the final test against South Africa at Ellis Park on Saturday.

Injuries accounted for three of the changes, with Mike Catt replacing Gregor Townsend at fly-half, Tony Underwood coming in for Alan Tait on the left wing and Mark Regan replacing Keith Wood at hooker.
The fourth change sees Neil Back preferred to Richard Hill on the flank.

The changes mean the Lions will field 10 Englishmen at Ellis Park. Catt said: "It's the opportunity of a lifetime for all of us. Walking onto Ellis Park with a Lions jersey on as a representative of northern hemisphere rugby is something I've never even dreamed about."
Catt is in because Townsend aggravated a thigh strain in training on Wednesday, while Tait and Wood both picked up groin strains in the series clinching 18-15 win in the second test .

Underwood, whose elder brother Rory won Lions test caps in New Zealand and Australia on the last two tours, picked up the confident mood of the camp when he said: "We intend to rub salt into springbok wounds on Saturday."

Regan, the Bristol and England hooker, has beaten off the challenge of Barry Williams. Regan said: "All 35 players in this squad have pushed each other to new heights. I've had to cope with being left out, but it's a never say die thing and I always thought I had a chance of playing."
Injuries have also forced changes among the substitutes with thigh strains for both Jason Leonard and Eric Miller ruling them out.

Team: 15-Neil Jenkins; 14-John Bentley, 13-Jeremy Guscott, 12-Scott Gibbs, 11-Tony Underwood; 10-Mike Catt, 9-Matt Dawson; 8-Tim Rodber, 7-Neil Back, 6-Lawrence Dallaglio, 5-Jeremy Davidson, 4-Martin Johnson (captain), 3-Paul Wallace, 2-Mark Regan, 1-Tom Smith.
Replacements: Tony Stimpson, Alan Bateman, Austin Healey, Barry Williams, David Young, Richard Hill.
